title: Appalling practice
body: I have been with Unsworth since I was a baby. I am now 39 years old. This was an amazing practice when I was a child, with doctors who were part of the community. It is now just a mess. Emails remain unanswered, it takes over 2 weeks to get a simple blood test and patients are still unable to request a face to face appointment with a GP without having to go through a triage call first where the doctor will determine if they want to see you. You never see the same doctor twice and it feels like they are doing you a favour. I feel very sorry for the reception and front line staff here who have clearly been instructed on protocols which do nothing but upset and annoy patients. The legacy and good name the former partners built up over 30 years has been utterly destroyed and the current partners should really be ashamed.

title: Fabulous care
body: I was seen very quickly in A&E  and went straight into resus where I was looked after and treated straight away. I was then taken to intensive care where I was continued to be looked after and treated for sepsis. The staff were all amazing and I want to say a big thank you for saving my life!

title: Excellent feedback
body: Comprehensive and very informative feedback following a blood test. Clear advice given and preventative strategies. Professionalism and care.

title: Great service provider
body: extremely efficient very caring, flexible appointments, any issues are always welcomed back, all staff members very kind& helpful.

title: X Ray
body: Went for x ray today 24.07 and the girls were amazing, quick efficient and really friendly. A credit to the team and very welcoming to everyone. Deserve a few kinds words for the great job they do.

title: Wonderful treatment
body:
I would like to thank you for your help and treatment and looking after me A and E.  X-ray and ct scan all staff where wonderfull 
Thank you.

title: Terrible
body: I visit at 9-10 unable to pass my bowel being sick for 10 days, urgent care doctor didn’t listen of is it a bladder infection have you hurt your back, walked out… end up spending a further 3 days in pain then moved the bowel blockage myself,,, at 3 am - 6 am in agony! 11 weeks after ct colocncooy still don’t have results! Total waste of time visiting this hospital! Currently still in pain but not going back to this hospital

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: good practice but they mess my prescritpion up
body: everytime i order all my tablets yous always miss my pain killers & they are 1 of my main tablets     & it gets me really wound up  because i have to do all again  so sort that out & i will be happy

title: Freeman day treatment centre
body: From start to finish every single member of staff was amazing, made me feel so relaxed before and after my op, from booking in to leaving, couldnt do enough for you, i highly recommend day treatment centre so thankyou all

title: Fantastic care
body: After a long labour with our first child I just had to leave a review for all the amazing midwives, consultants & anaesthetists who looked after us. The care we received was exemplary, compassionate and respectful to our wishes. We saw a lot of shift changes being in labour for a long length of time and everyone who looked after us was just fantastic. I wanted to say a massive thank you particularly in light of the bad press they are all receiving at the moment, you all do such an amazing job, Thank you all from the Birtwistle family.

title: No Aftercare
body: I had two surgerys in October 22 at the ENT Department. I was a day patient after  I eventually came round after anaesthetic the consultant came round too my bed & literally ripped the padding out my nose! It was so unexpected & very painful! Then sent home, I have been due to go back for check ups & my appointment has been cancelled twice at last minute. I'm struggling still & having issues with my Ears & nose resulting in me having infections, dizziness & breathing problems I'm very disappointed & I just feel I was just another object on a conveyer belt. I've now got to wait until September for another appointment not good at all when your feeling rubbish.

title: Excellent service
body: Vine House gets a lot of negative comments. Just want to say that the treatment I received yesterday was excellent. After going for a health review yesterday the nurse noticed something that needed immediate attention and arranged for me to see a doctor straight away.

title: Disappointed
body:
There is always someone by the desk that holds othe parents register for their application.
First time a lady was holding talking for 45 minutes when I had to ask to be seen and others while this lady carries on.
Second time another lady holding usthe same I asked to ne seen while she carried on for the entire time I waited to see a GP 30 minutes without any luck so I left the surgery.
I am sorry to say this surgery is like a cattle market.

title: Bad experience
body: Called in to see if my husband prescription ready, to be told it was down for signing that day Monday, told the receptionist that he run out of one of the medication and he would need it today( baring in mind prescription went in on the Thursday) was told to ring back later which I did, to be told it wouldn't be signed till the end of surgery and ring back just after 6pm, ring back after 6pm  no answer kept on ringing finally get through answering machine, go down to chemist to be told no prescription, if I needed emergency medication would have to ring out of hours,  when your husband relies on certain medications this is not acceptable to have to ring round  trying to get his tablets, ring Bardot to get medication then have to go and pick prescription up, this is not a duty of care when someone relies on there medication.

title: 4 days for a tetanus jab
body: I clame into the surgery Mon 24th after a dog bite the previous day and was offered an appointment on Thurs 3pm for a tetanus jab. Surely this needed immediate attention, would a jab be of any use 4 days later? Surely for a minor jab time could be found sometime during the day. I am absolutely disgusted at what you call a service.

title: Not listened too
body: I'm struggling to get any doctors to listen to me and understand that I'm housebound and cant get to the surgery none of the doctors are understanding its a case of if your face fits you will get the help iv Always been treated different to anyone else who have mental health like at the present time I'm having panic attacks in the house which is stopping me do day to day but as usual  it's been ignore even though iv sent a e consult

title: Timeous and courteous
body: We requested a referral letter fir haematology; it was promised within a week; it was produced the same day. Thanks to reception staff and the busy GP who did the letter.

title: Amazing people
body: Had to have a major operation and have to say every person I came into contact with was amazing,so highly skilled and so caring,so from the bottom of my heart I thank you all.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body:
Prompt, polite, professional. In short an excellent practice.

Highly recommend and may it long continue. 
 
Sincerely..

title: Excellent care
body:
I would thoroughly recommend the beh..very professional  staff.
I was struggling to be seen by another hospital after my cataract op didn’t go according to plan . .not the fault of my surgeon…I went to the walk in clinic in June....I was seen by a dr within 10 mins and an op within the hour..fragment lens were removed.
I was given the choice to stay with the hospital or return to my original hospital..I’m so glad I stayed.
I had to wait three months for the eye to heal and then the consultant  squeezed me into his busy schedule..he said I’d waited long enough (jan first cataract op)
A lens was put in my eye last week..the following morning my consultant gave me a call to make sure I was ok and also I had a checkup with him.
I’m in awe of him and the rest of his staff..what fantastic work they do..thank you doesn’t seem enough!
It’s not all about the work they do, ops etc it’s their kind caring attitude..I felt so safe in their hands..nothing was too much trouble.
Very grateful to you all and very much appreciated.
One of the very best hospitals in the country.

title: Room for improvement
body: It seems the GPs seems never want to see their patients. Giving patients a telephone consultation and meeting the patient should occupy same amount of time. I live quite close to the centre, and willing to visit the centre to have face to face contact with the GP because I can easily express my condition. The staff at the reception are very nice, but not helpful.

title: Great experiencej
body: All staff very attentive while being assessed before and after the procedure,couldn’t have asked for better ..

title: Poor organisation and facilities
body:
Attended a and e as a result of no gp availability and advice from health clinic.
Registration completed and seen by triage within 1 hour so that works fine.
4 hours later still waiting to see a doctor for treatment and diagnosis.
Eventually gave up went home and paid for private treatment from Bupa.
Nhs is not fit for purpose despite all the hype.
Suggestions to make the wait more bearable at a and e in Princess Royal Haywards Heath.
The waiting area is far too small to cope with demand so patients are spread out over 2 or 3 extra areas so staff are then running around trying to find patients and wasting time.Why don’t you use a tannoy system.
There is literally no information at all about where an individual is in the queue you could be there for one hour or ten hours just one screen that shows how long it takes to see triage or a doctor however when does that start from ie when you registered or at the current moment in time.
Use screens to show individuals wait times dependant on urgency and current demand.
The ventilation in the dept is inadequate it’s hot and stuffy especially when patients are waiting 4 hours plus so sort out the sitcom.
No vending machines only one cold water supplier shared by staff and patients.Improve facilities for both.
Frequent unattended alarms sounding for hours seemingly for no reason and not switched off by staff causing alarm and noise distress.
Patients vital signs being taken in the waiting area amongst the seating so lack of privacy for affected patients.
Generally a third world experience for what is supposed to be the pride of Britain.
If the idea is to discourage anyone going to a and e its a very successful tactic.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Human touch
body: I'd like to commend the nurse and the receptionist for doing a great job. My appointment was on time. The receptionist was friendly and helped me with the self check-in. The nurse was super friendly. We chatted about our kids while she informed me about the procedure and what she was doing. She gave me advice for future tests. I can only commend the staff in the clinic for empathizing and caring for their patients despite their hectic schedules. Well done and thank you for the human touch!

title: Great practice and staff
body: Doctor was brilliant and listened to my issues in fact the whole clinic from the nurses to the receptionist are brilliant

title: Poor
body: Tried ringing for over an hour no answer when ringing then goes dead. Tried online form only to be stopped and advice to ring surgery, but line keeps going dead

title: Awful Experience
body: It seems antagonistic every time you phone, simple requests are treated with contempt, Moulsham lodge use to be a great surgery with great doctors, now its just a shambles, when you get to actually see a doctor though they are very nice, its just the red tape you have to go through to speak to someone.

title: Completely patronising
body:
Had a 5 minute telephone appointment for an annually check up I've had before.
The tone and style I was spoken to was patronising and condescending. I was reprimanded and words such as"why are you refusing our medical advice". 
No interest at all shown in my state of being post operative from surgery two days prior.

title: Needs to be closed after the next CQC inspection.
body:
We have been patients at this surgery for over 10years now.
However the surgery is no longer able to provide care for the patients.

Seeing a GP is impossible. There are no appointments available.

We are told to call at 8.30am for same day and emergency appointments but after staying on the line for 10/15 minutes we are told by the receptionist that there are no appointments available and no telephone consultations available.
The CQC report from Nov 2022 reports that this surgery is inadequate and will be re-assessed in 6 months -the time for another inspection is here and the surgery needs to be closed.

Very disappointed in this surgery and will now be changing to a surgery that serves its purpose.

author: Nina986
title: Day Surgery
body: I was very scared but was made to feel so much better by the wonderful staff #Queenie was amazing as was her trainee. My surgeon made me feel at ease even though he said it how it should be, well done guys you all work so hard.

title: Indifferent!!
body:
February 2023 I submitted a letter of referral to the receptionist from specsavers, outlining the deterioration of my eyes due to cataracts.
After several months I enquired with same reception about any response. The referral could not be found only the letter from the optician. No referral made!
A referral was sent in April 2023 to Rheumatology at Frimley hospital, a response was received asking for more details of my condition, nothing was received by mid June after enquiring with the hospital.
I made 4 visits to the surgery reception, of whom none were obviously interested in what I was saying, asking for this to be done, on each occasion I was assured the request was being dealt with.
I called the hospital 24/07/23, still nothing received.
What does it take to get anything dealt with????

title: Great service
body: I was greeted by friendly receptionist and the clinician I saw was really nice and friendly. I was seen before my appointment time

title: Great consultation
body:
My wife and children were at the clinic for their new medical check up. This Healthcare Assistant (cant remember her name) was exceptional and very detailed. She even introduced the NHS Healthcheck  to my wife and explained what it was all about and encouraged her for blood tests. 
I myself never heard of the NHs health check.

Well done HCA

author: whisperqq67
title: Massage at the Fern Centre
body:
I was given the opportunity to have massages at the Fern Centre. The office staff were really considerate in allowing me to start at a suitable time around my treatment. The volunteers welcomed me warmly each week as I arrived. The room was comfortable and quiet, with relaxing music playing in the background. Sarah my therapist was amazing. Super lovely. She always checked in to see how I was before and after each session. Massages were tailored to my needs and preferences, and care was always given to anything that needed to be taken into consideration due to my cancer diagnosis and resultant treatment.  
These massages were thoroughly enjoyed after a year of surgeries, chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Thanks so much Sarah for volunteering your time and skills, and to the Fern Centre for facilitating such wonderful experiences.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst practice ever
body: You're told to call at 8 am when you do exactly that you're number 34 in the queue, once you finally get through 1.5hrs later you get told nothing available try online when you already have at the exact time of call 8:00am and it says capacity full for the day. Doesn't make any sense when you've already seen a dr and received medicine and that dr has left a note for the follow up but still need to call at 8 or go through the online form. Dont know who the liars are drs??

title: Waste of nhs time
body: Went for my annual review with a nurse ,had 50 min appointment, arrive to be told by the nurse I don't know how to do asthma/Copd reviews. Waste of my time and nhs money

title: Unbelievable
body: Had text from gp with tel nos to arrange xray. Corbett hosp. Checked opening times tried one number, Closed. Tried other number given no reply. Rang 01384 456111 spoke to receptionist gave me number for Guest hosp who arrange appnts at Corbett hosp. Guess what no reply. What am I supposed to do now?

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Worried mum 111
title: Ambulance Service
body:
My daughter has been unwell with a sick bug, she deteriorated quickly this morning. While I was on the phone to nhs 24 because I was concerned about her things took a turn and we couldn’t wake her up. The lovely lady at nhs 24 sent an ambulance straight away. They were here within 20 minutes (felt like 3 days) and the 2 paramedics were genuinely amazing.  
I was in a state of panic and they reassured me continuously and they spent a long time making sure my daughter was ok. She came round and was doing ok but her blood sugars were really low and she was again sick after food so they took us into RACH.  
It seems like she had a hypo because her sugars were so low because she can’t keep food or drink down. We are home again and she’s doing good but the genuine care from the paramedics and other staff was amazing. In a time where all I hear is bad about the NHS I wanted to post the positive. Thank you so much to Iain and (I think) Marcus. Marcus had a way with kids that’s special.  
Thank you.

title: Improving
body: It's a shame the booking process is such an issue because once you see a doctor the service is great.

title: Good practice
body: I appreciate the GP professional attention and expertise. The appointment was timely and precise. We were done within minutes and he assured me that a further action or referral will be given to my son who has a knee injury. He assured us a physiotherapist will see him soon to assess the knee injury and take it up from there

author: pagerwb96
title: My stay in ward 66
body: Admitted to ward 66 in July laminectomy, during this time the care shown to me by the staff was above and beyond, a big thank you to all the staff and especially to Emma, whom the NHS should be proud to have on its workforce, Thank you all.

title: Not a great practice
body: Time keeping horrible in this place. 20-30 mins wait per appointment. Why do they accept out of area people when they can’t handle the patients that live in the area. Ridiculous need a gp consultant for my 2 month old unable to get. No online booking system so have to use the old fashioned waiting around on the phone and then be told no appointments

title: Brilliant
body: Having to have a colonoscopy I was scared, from the moment I stepped into reception I was put at ease. Excellent service from every single person I met from reception all through to recovery room. Thank you all. Keep up the good work.

title: super service
body:
i attended for a gp x-ray , the service received was first class , quick , polite , efficient 
thank you

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: SueG
title: The NHSL should be immensely proud of their employees
body:
I was admitted to A&E at Monklands a couple days ago. I spent 28hours there awaiting a bed in WGH. The A+E staff were wonderful. It's hard to remember a huge amount about my stay there because I was so sore but I do know I was looked after. The paramedics who brought me there were so kind and compassionate including the ambulance staff who then transferred me to WD 15 at WGH.  
I am still a current inpatient in Ward 15 in Wishaw. The staff are just utterly superb. They are kind, understanding, patient, happy and literally cannot do enough for you. These angels work so hard and it's heartbreaking because I know they're short staffed. It's lovely to see people who truly care and have immense compassion and understanding. I hate that I need help from them because they have enough to do.  
The physiotherapists are wonderful, encouraging and have been so patient with me and will hopefully give me the all clear to go home tomorrow.  
Your domestic staff are excellent. They have the place sparkling and they're always smiling too.  
The porters who brought me to MRI are lovely and the radiology staff there are also lovely. They put me at ease the whole time.  
Thank you Wishaw General for providing me with outstanding care and as much as I don't ever want to come back, if I had to, I know I would be well cared for.  
The staff are immaculate in their uniforms. The NHSL should be immensely proud of their employees and I hope they know that they do their job to a high standard.

author: caelumqe69
title: I couldn’t have asked for better care.
body: I attended A&E in the mater hospital Belfast after having a fall and was unable to move my arm, everyone who looked after me did so with compassion. I couldn’t have asked for better care. Our nhs is a truly remarkable service, I think we all need to remember that.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Seizure
body:
I had a seizure on holiday in Dartmouth. The hotel porter phoned for an ambulance which arrived within half an hour. I was treated in the ambulance while going to hospital. The crew gave a full report to the doctor and later myGP. I was given a brain and chest scan and found to have a chest infection which was treated with antibiotics. When all complete I was picked up by my son and returned home to Bristol.
I cannot express enough praise on the doctors nurses and ambulance crew. I am now home feeling better waiting to go to my GP for a follow up.
Well done!!

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

author: woodpeckerbm74
title: I had an asthma review
body: Really helpful in what I can do better to prevent worsening my asthma.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent communication
body:
The communication has been excellent, there has been no miscommunication through nurses, doctors etc. I have found everyone to be very helpful and direct. The nurses are so good if there's anything you need, they are with you in a flash.  
The food is lovely, I have enjoyed all the meals so far, but my appetite could be better as I could probably be eating a lot more.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No need for a casualty visit
body: Nurse practitioner advised an elderly family member to attend casualty, even though it was clear the problem was shingles (we did actually say to practitioner that we thought it looked like shingles, but was advised they didn’t think it was). Doctor at casualty department couldn’t understand why we had been referred there, as soon as we walked into room he said it was shingles. He said a call should’ve been made to the eye infirmary as the shingles was in the eye region and causing blurred vision and there was no reason for him to be in casualty as GP could’ve administered medication and made an eye infirmary referral.

title: Unprofessional
body: The GP had requested an X-ray. The receptionist never bothered to organise it until I questioned it weeks later. In July 2023 I have been contacted to pick up a requested prescription only to go to the pharmacy and learn the receptionist has never approached the GP. Yet I was contacted by the GPs office to pick up a none existent prescription. Also in this month July 2023 I was text after a missed appointment to attend an appointment that was never confirmed. I returned a call to the GPs office. It was unknown why I was called. When I questioned unconfirmed missed booking that appointment was never recorded for that date. Clearly the desk is overstaffed if any receptionist has time to play these silly games with patients.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is great
body:
My stay has been good, the care is great you couldn't get much better. The staff are amazing, I am appreciative for them all. the food isn't very nice but I cant complain.  
The communication has been good, the nurses and doctors are really informative and have gave updates regularly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Exceptional patient service
body: The staff on reception are very professional and friendly. The GPs and practice nurse that I’ve experienced over the years have been knowledgable, thorough and caring. I want to thank them for doing such a great job in sometimes difficult circumstances. They are an example of how a good GP practice should be run.

author: Rebyc53
title: Chest Xray
body:
Called a wee bit earlier than appointment very nice lady. Shown where to change into gown in nice clean room.  
Very efficient did not take long.  
Was asked if I had a follow up appointment with doctor.

author: LynneM
title: Gold standard cardiac care
body:
My husband had a heart attack at home. We called for an ambulance which arrived within 15 mins and he received swift care from the paramedics. His ECG was sent electronically to Ninewells and he was blue lighted straight to Ninewells cardiac catheterisation lab where he had stents inserted. He was transferred to coronary care unit and then to ward 1.  
I would like to commend all teams on the gold standard care he received by them all. In particular paramedic Veronica, CN Gemma in CCU, Cath lab SN Stacey and SN Alisa in wd 1. All of these professionals went over and above in my opinion to care for both my husband and I and take time to explain exactly what had happened and reassure both of us.  
Ward 1 staff were all so lovely and caring towards all patients and I got the sense they are a great team who were cheerful, welcoming and helpful and a great example to their student nurses.  
1st class care and we both can’t thank these teams enough

title: Good and improving
body:
Great service. Filled in an online form at 8am, Dr rang at 10am and prescription ready for collection straight away from the dispensary. Dr very friendly, understanding and knowledgeable. Spoke to receptionist at one point who was polite but not particularly helpful, and didn’t seem keen on interacting, perhaps that’s a result of the kind of communication they’ve been getting recently, I don’t know.
Overall Good service and much improved from a year ago.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Really lovely staff
body: The care is 100%. The staff are all really lovely, they have been a great help. The communication is good, facilities are all fine, i have no problems or complaints with anything. I don't think there is anything that needs improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Life saving diagnosis
body:
Dr examined me after discussing condition, blood samples taken, 4pm Dr phoned me telling me to go straight to A&E where I received the urgent medical treatment I required. The Dr was very experienced in spotting the warning signs.
Reception staff were also polite and professional.

title: One of the best
body: Very kind people, always try to accommodate patient's preferences and doctors are very good too. Highly recommended.

title: Dreadful
body: Phoned the surgery on behalf of my wife as she is unable to make phone calls at the moment, asking for an Emergency Appointment. Was told she had to use their website and register via my GP. It is a waste of time using this surgery.  The receptionist was very uninterested and couldn't wait to put the phone down. This surgery has become worse over the last few years. I will be looking for a new doctors as the whole practice seems uninterested in giving the care they took an oath to give

author: Put at ease
title: Urgent care
body: I injured my ankle and phoned NHS 24 who effeciently arranged for me to attend the minor injuries service at ayr hospital. I received nothing less than outstanding care from the emergency nurse practitioner Jillian. She was friendly, caring and professional and i was assessed, treated and provided with tailored after care information. Outstanding service from a nurse who is a credit to her profession

title: Difficult to deal with
body: I have had 3 reasons to request an urgent appointment for unrelated acute conditions in the last few weeks. In the first 2 cases, I was able to get a call-back when I reached the front of the telephone queue for reception. In each case I was triaged and in the first case I was given a same day appointment with a nurse practitioner. In the second case I was offered an appointment with a physio 6 weeks later. I declined this, restating my condition. I was finally given a same day appointment, again with a nurse practitioner. Today, I had need to call again - this time I was put into a queue with no option for a call-back and that didn't seem to be getting smaller. I was eventually disconnected. The website advises patients to download DrIQ, which I have done. None of the options for consultation, self help or medication align with my issues so I have no option but to contact the surgery by phone. I do not often have cause to contact the practice but, when I do, I am reluctant to do so because the experience is so painful. I would transfer to another practice were it not for the fact that the Camrose, Gillies, Hackwood Partnership is so big that there are few alternatives left in the borough

title: Quick and efficient service
body:
I went to the centre after having a fall over the weekend and being concerned about my hip which had been replaced less than a year ago.
It appeared busy but the receptionist was very helpful and said that the wait should not be too long as most patients were waiting for dressing etc rather than for an assessment.  I had barely sat down when I was called by the 'streaming' nurse and then hardly waited at all before seeing the next nurse who said he had worked in orthopaedics for 16 years.  He thoroughly examined my hip and thigh and said that the hip joint and femur were fine and would not require an X-ray. I had just suffered bruising above and below the hip joint as well as cuts and bruises to my face, hand and arm.  My total time at the centre was amazingly only around 40 minutes and I left feeling totally assured that no real damage had resulted from my fall.  I am most grateful to the staff who were all so kind, helpful and efficient.

title: Great practice
body: From reception, you will feel they are concerned about your health, very professional and will allocate a date for your appointment. The doctors are very compassionate and will do every thing to make your referral as soon as possible

title: Quick and efficient visit to Compton surgery
body: Appointment at 10.00 on Monday 24th July. Seen on time, quick consultant with the doctor   and left soon after with prescriptions.

author: paprikabr55
title: Support from GP and practice nurse
body:
I would like to express my gratitude. And thanks for the care and support I have received for many years from Dr Richard  
The care from Dr Afuakwah (GP), Alison and Carrie the practice nurses has always been exceptional, supporting me in my changing health needs over the past 5 years.  
The care and support I have received has been caring, supportive, understanding with diligence and respect from everyone including the receptionists Sheila and Rosemary who are always happy to help.  
I would like to wish Dr Afuakwah and Alison, practice nurse all the best for their retirement. Additionally, I just wish to thank them all as I will be moving practice due to moving out of the practice area. Thank you

author: JulieJ68
title: Cannot praise them enough. Thank you
body:
Appointment at Clinic 8 (ECC) with gastroenterology ? Mr Aslam / Dawn (HCA) & phlebotomy.  
One of the most positive. Helpful, compassionate, empathetic appointments I have ever had.  
Cannot praise them enough. Thank you

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have a really good attitude
body:
It has been really great up here on CCU. The staff have all been really good. Their communication with me has been perfect and they always have a really good attitude. Sinead in particular has been excellent. However, absolutely everyone has been brilliant.  
The ward itself has been perfectly clean and comfortable. I have absolutely loved all the food I have been given. The bathrooms are also always kept spotless. I have no suggestions for improvements.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bereaved family
title: Excellent care
body:
My husband recently amputated his big toe with a lawn mower.  
I would like to thank all the staff involved in his care, skill and expertise by the surgeon who reattached the toe. Excellent inpatient and outpatient care has meant that he now has full use of the toe.  
Having just moved from South Wales we have been amazed by the excellent local facilities, prompt communications, well run clinics and high standards of care from all staff involved.

author: Nan Reetam
title: Audiology out patient appointment
body:
My elderly aunt who has mobility and heart problems, was referred to audiology regarding hearing loss (at request of my aunt).  
We arrived for our appointment at 20 minutes early for the appointment and I was disappointed to find the door on the department was closed for lunch. I completely understand that staff are on their lunch break but we were left in a corridor with no seating area available until the appointment time. It was only good fortune that another niece had accessed a wheelchair, rather than use the normal walker, that she was able to be comfortable in her seat. I do feel that access to seating is an important factor as many of the patients will be elderly and be unable to stand in a corridor.  
Our appointment went generally well with the audiologist who carried out a hearing review and proposed getting a hearing aid fitted. I was however frustrated to learn that a mould of my aunts’ ear could not be taken today as she has a build of ear wax that would affect the shape of the mould. I understand the rationale behind this of course but it would have been useful if we had been told to have this looked at prior to our appointment.  
The GP referral occurred 9 months ago and frustratingly without an ear examination at the time or since. The GP surgery, in Ahoghill, also no longer do ear wax removal and I have now got an appointment with a pharmacy to clear her ear wax.  
This now means further outings for someone who is unable to be mobile for long, and a further delay in her hearing aid fitting. There is also an additional cost for an elderly pensioner. Had we known to look into ear wax removal I would’ve made sure that this had taken place in advance of our audiology appointment which would make the process more efficient for everyone.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: No problems, no complaints.
body: I was transferred by ambulance from daisy hill hospital to Craigavon hospital. this ward is great the staff have provided good care to me and I'm very grateful. I've enough space and privacy in the bay that I share with other patients. From what I have seen the ward and facilities are kept clean by the staff as there cleaned regularly throughout the day. The food has been dead-on, my apatite isn't the best. So far I have had no problems on this ward so I cant complain.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Craigneuk
title: Ampution of pinky finger
body:
I had a discussion with the surgeon Dr.McLean about my condition I had with knots & bumps and gradually my pinky bent forward and I couldn’t straighten at all.  
The choice made was to have the finger amputated. I’m 4 weeks post surgery and my hand is healing very well. Thanks to the nurses at the orthopaedic nurses.

author: orangere88
title: Helpful and accommodating staff
body: I arrived late to my appointment at the Branston clinic, due to an unexpected road closure on the A38. Having struggled to get an appointment due to the switchboard being so busy, I was worried I'd lose my appointment, and arrived a bit flustered. However, the staff were very understanding, and managed to fit me in for my appointment anyway. I really appreciated them being so accommodating, and I received friendly, helpful service from all the staff I interacted with.

author: OskaSophie
title: Hip Operation Grantham Hospital
body: I had keyhole superpath hip surgery...this is my 2nd hip operation in 2 years. I was feeling OK as I knew what to expect. I was hoping all would go OK. The staff of Matron Julie, Ward Manager Charley, RN Naomi and Judy, Health Care Iwons plus Sarah/Jane kept coming to check I was OK, showed me to my room. They were very attentive which I haven't experienced for a while, they showed they care. I have not had that type of caring experience for ages.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff couldn't be more helpful
body:
It has been absolutely fantastic up here on the Coronary Care Ward - it has been really good. The staff have all been absolutely brilliant - they really couldn't be any more help. They most definitely ensure that they explain everything to me. Everyone has been very good - I couldn't name anyone in particular as they all have equal responsibility and have been excellent. The staff always make sure you are not sitting waiting too long. When it comes to staff attitude, I have found them to be very approachable. They always make sure to answer any of my questions and if they don't know the answer they always make sure to go and find one for you.  
The ward itself has been incredibly clean and comfortable. Any food I have had has been brilliant - absolutely first class. All the bathrooms have been 100% as well.  
I have no suggestions for improvement - all has been brilliant and it has been a great experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aurigabw66
title: I would rate them all 10 out of 10
body: my daughter was admitted 2 children's ward in Dumfries from being admitted 2 leaving the staff were amazing nothing was any trouble, they where so kind and patient with my daughter. This was first time in hospital for my daughter so it was scary for her but all staff made it so comfortable for her so i would rate them all 10 out of 10

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Lovely smiley faces from staff
body:
My experience on Coronary Care has been absolutely brilliant. I really couldn't ask for better staff - they really have been excellent. All their explanations have been very good. They all have a really lovely attitude and always approach you with lovely smiley faces. Every single one of them has been brilliant - I couldn't name anyone in particular over the other.  
Coronary Care has been spotless and I have been made to be very comfortable. The food has all been lovely - I have had no problems in that regards. I have no suggestions for improvement - the staff really can't do any better than they are already doing.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Couldn't wish for better care
body:
I really couldn't ask for better care than I have received up on Coronary Care. The staff have all been brilliant. All the explanations from staff have been good. The staff have always got a super attitude. I couldn't name anyone in particular as they have all been good.  
The ward has been very clean and I have been very comfy. The food has all been great. All the bathrooms have been fine as well.  
I have no suggestions for improvement - the staff are doing extremely well with the hassle they have to put up with.

title: Great practice
body: Doctor and reception lady, were very nice. Doctor asked lot of questions about my problem and gave me all the information about the results of my blood test,and reffer me to a head scan.

title: Caring practice.
body: An excellent appointment. I had everything thoroughly explained to me which put me completely at ease. We are very lucky to have such dedicated staff looking after us. Thank you

author: Always grateful
title: Emergency Department visit
body: I went to A&E yesterday at the QEUH at 37 weeks pregnant with severe chest pains. The care I received was second to none. The nurses were all so personable, and took time to chat to me. The doctor was amazing, so thorough, so professional and so lovely. I have no idea what any of their names were cos I was so distressed when they were introducing their selves. But I just want to say a massive thank you, you all made me feel so at ease and safe.

title: Worst practice!
body:
I have been with the practice since 2018, for the past year has been a nightmare and it actually caused me to become severly depressed and diagnosed to various health issues all as result to stress that this oractice has caused me, as I begged the gps to help me. I ended up hospitalised 5times this year. I never hospitalised in my life. Clinical letters are not being actioned accordingly, I had to wait for 5 moths for them to action letters, and that happen only cause I had access to my records and I found it. They have noempathy and lack the bare minimum of care that you should give to a patient. A "social priscriber" spoke to me in april and told me that my my case is urgent. I never heared back!! I have been for past 1.30h tryin to speak to someone, and when I get through the receptionist hangs up on you, which makes you more frustated, now being caller 17 in a que. 

Traumatising and sadly coming from a former NHS Manager

title: how do you get an appointment
body: I recived a text asking me to make an appointment to see a GP. I called and was told I need to call at 8.30am for an appointment. 3 days I tried but couldn't get through. I guess I need to wait till its bad enough to goto a&e

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female surgical has been a safe haven
body:
Female surgical has been good. I cannot complain about anything. The treatment I have been getting has been so good and I am feeling a lot better. The facilities here are top class and everything is clean.  
The staff are friendly people and so easy to approach and ask questions. They tell me everything that is going on with my care and are so honest with me. I like that they let me have an input into my care and my care is based around me.  
Female surgical has been a safe haven.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: useless
body: I called the surgery in March this year for an appointment to be told I could have a face to face, I went to the surgery to find I was seeing the practice nurse who couldn't even pronounce my name properly and was extremely rude when I tried to give her some history of why I was there, on leaving I asked the receptionist if I could make an appointment to see a Doctor, she told me you have just seen someone, I said okay and went to leave and she shouted let me check your notes so I walked back and I couldn't believe what she said to me, "You need to change your lifestyle" this from the receptionist, I have lost all faith in this Doctors, recently I was told when I tried to get a prescription that all the Doctors were out on emergency calls another time that there is no Doctors in after 12 noon, I could go on and on but nothing will improve.

title: No one turned up.
body: I had an 11:00am appointment today. Its currently 11:43 and all the app says is "sorry for the delay, no GP assigned". As an autistic person it's really distressing to have this happen. I am understanding of delays to degree but being left in limbo is frustrating to say the least. This appointment was important to me. I don't think I'll be using the app again.

title: Poor communication
body: Had a biopsy done and had to ring the clinic to get my results when I hadn’t heard anything, was given a Mobile number to ring which went to answer phone, left a message explaining and nothing happened, rang the next week and got an appointment for that week, had a second biopsy and after 3 weeks I rang to be told yes my results are back and a doctor will ring before the end of the week.. nothing happened! Rang back following Monday and they said a doctor has seen the notes and a letter is being sent out to you?, waited another week and nothing they also said I don’t know why someone here said a doctor would ring you?? So now today 25/07/23 I have rung again to be told the doctor or consultant hasn’t looked at it yet but I should get a call by the end of the week and if I don’t then to ring them back!! And this is on the cancer pathway!? Woefully bad communication

title: Great Practice
body: Online form was easy to use and call came from the Practice within two hours. Doctor was very helpful and efficiently dealt with my concerns.

author: Tiljz86
title: Endocrine services
body:
I feel I have had abysmal care from this service in the last 3 years. I have spoken to the consultant twice in 3 years. It has taken up to 5 months to receive a letter where someone has completed a virtual review and instigated a change in medication.  
I have now been given too high a dose of medication and now experiencing symptoms of hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism. This is making me feel incredibly unwell, where I have had to take time off work I can’t afford.  
The endocrine nurse is off sick and it seems there is no one willing to help. I have to wait until they return which is an unknown time period.  
A 5 minute telephone call from someone else i.e. the consultant apparently is not possible. I’m now going to be waiting another long period of time

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Far exceeded my expectations
body:
My time on the Male Medical Ward in Daisy Hill Hospital has been brilliant so far – it has been absolutely fantastic. I have been in lots of hospitals in my rime and I have to say that Daisy Hill has been absolutely superb. The staff are all brilliant and always explain things well. They always make sure to introduce themselves and they try as much as possible to anticipate your needs. They always have a friendly and caring attitude. There are several staff members that have stood out to me. Rebecca on today has been amazing. Martin has also been absolutely brilliant. Damian who is on at night always makes sure to keep us all entertained. Finally, Colm is always going round asking if there is anything he can get me.  
The ward itself has been very clean and comfortable. The beds are changed very regularly and the staff are always going round making the beds. The food has actually been great as well. I have also noticed how if someone gets the wrong meal, they try their absolute best to rectify and sort it.  
I would be hard pressed to find any improvements. My experience here at Daisy Hill Hospital has far exceeded my expectations!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The special care baby unit is equipped for everything
body:
I had my baby a few days ago and he has been in SCBU since. The treatment he is getting seems to be working as he is looking livelier. He has started eating and hopefully we will get home soon. SCBU is so clean and everything has to be disinfected due to the babies in here.  
The staff are something else and I cannot thank them enough for what they have done for me. Since I cannot be here all the time the nurses are great at telling me what has happened when I was away.  
The special care baby unit is equipped for everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The special care baby unit has a formidable team
body:
SCBU has been stressful but the best. My baby was unwell and had to be transferred here, it has been a stressful time but the treatment and care that is being given is such a life saver. I am starting to relax as I see the difference in my baby's demeanor.  
The staff are amazing, I cannot believe the difference they have made to my baby's life. They have done so much for me and I could never repay them. The nurses have kept me in the loop of what has been happening and not doing anything without my consent.  
The special care baby unit has a formidable team.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are great
body:
DAU was a bit more complicated to find since I am used to going to the bottom of the corridor yet it has changed to a different place. The reception staff at the front desk were lovely enough to direct me to the right place. It looks far bigger and more organised.  
The staff are great and seem to have adapted quickly if this place is only new. They knew where everything was. I enjoyed the staff they were nice and smiled a lot, which showed they like their jobs.  
Direct assessment unit has changed in a good way.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Missed consultations/reviews
body:
Two consultations/reviews had been arranged for my mother via text messages, with the newly assigned paramedic, to the surgery. The dates and times booked according to their availability. On both occasions I had to ensure I was with my mother, to undertake the consultations/reviews. Unfortunately I did not receive a call on either occasion, which is frustrating to say the least. My mother is housebound and both reviews (her annual health review and frailty review), are very important in terms of her ongoing health issues at the moment and more so because she is unable to attend the surgery to be seen by a health practitioner. 

Going forward it would be most helpful and considerate for any future arranged consultations/reviews to be followed through and undertaken with the patient.

author: Black sheep
title: I’m very concerned as I no longer know what I’ve had
body:
I wasn’t feeling well and my friend called 999 they transported me to Borders General Hospital,(A&E) which was great. Eventually I was transferred to ward 6, my partner came in the following day to be told I had a stroke but now was resolved, which was good to hear.  
My discharge letter stated the wrong name and I had been admitted with vertigo obviously this discharge letter was not mine but on certain parts of the letter it stated my name. There was nothing to suggest I had a stroke/TIA so obviously I’m very concerned as I no longer know what I’ve had,  
I’d be very grateful if you can look into this for me  
Kind regards

title: Very good practice
body: I've used this practice for 4yrs.  The improvements in service over that timeare excellent. Appointments are usually available, prescriptions delivered to pharmacy on time. A recent hiccup in my health was treated with care and consideration by 3 doctors and a consequent plan for care by the hospital put in place.  I have no complaints whatsoever! Well done Harbury Surgery.

title: Many thanks.
body:
I would like to thank all the Doctors, Nurses, receptionist etc for all their professional care since I was first diagnosed with heart problem issues, they have all been fantastic since day one and I really can’t thank them enough.
I would like to extend my thanks also to all the NHS Staff also at Broadgreen Hospital, in the Cardio Version team, echocardiogram staff, cardio rehabilitation and the Royal Liverpool echocardiogram staff.
They really have all been unbelievable. 
Got back to playing football with my six year grandson again, nearly beat him.
Thank you all,

title: Referrals
body:
After asking my Dr on numerous occasions to chase up my referral.
I'm now find myself chasing up the referral and this isn't the first time with the Dr.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The high dependency unit has me feeling a lot better
body:
HDU has been great. I probably would not be here if it were not for this place. The ward is perfect the way it is. We all have a good bit of our own space and are not too cramped, and the curtains are pulled so we are not invading each others privacy. I am glad of the visitors as it is something to look forward to.  
The staff have been top class, I cannot fault them at all. With their constant care and watchful eye over me I have been getting better and more back to myself.  
The high dependency unit has me feeling a lot better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: L Cat Lover
title: Depression, alcohol addiction and grief
body:
I've been dealing with my mental health issues since my teens. I've been in and out of outpatient help. When my father (my biggest support/reason for staying sober) passed away in 2018, it sent me over the edge.  
Everything has progressively gotten so much worse. My CPN who had supported me through all this passed away suddenly and unexpectedly. One of our 4 cats at home also passed suddenly and tragically in a car accident. She was my father's favourite, they had a special bond. I'm crying as I write this because I'm so overwhelmed constantly over the thought of death.  
I am unable to understand or comprehend how my family have managed to move on and I feel anger towards them for doing it but also anger towards myself for being unable to do it. I feel lost and alone.  
However, Lisa has taken time to ensure I never feel this way, to give me reassurance that I always have someone to talk to. She has been a rock for me and continues to show me that there can be people working in this field who really do understand and resonate rather than just going by a book. She is utterly amazing and I feel so lucky to have her as a support through this.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership
